messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:41): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: What should XHR.status return for an HTTP/0.9 response?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:42): that's what the spec currently says
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:45): null is what I'd expect if it didn't exist and the object had a suitable state
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:46): or maybe HTTP should define what the status code is in that case :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:46): as in, if no status code is provided the status code is 200
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:47): goes back to his semi-sleepy state
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:53): maybe the guy who created the Squirrelfish logo can make one
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:54): though I'm not sure it's all that impressive to survive to 0x20
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:54): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I've just managed to get -9 returned by .status
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:56): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: I hope it's your birthday, seeming it claims that on Facebook ;P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:56): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: "HTTP /1.1 200 OK" does all kinds of odd things.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Including giving .status = -9 in IE
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:59): oh, IE has all kinds of weird stuff with .status
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:00): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: please provide your assessment of the following
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:00): I need to provide assessment? Meh.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:01): finds fridge empty again, reduced to eating olives from jar
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:18): HTTP is just as broken as the rest of the Web, it's just noticed by less people than the brokenness of HTML/CSS
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:19): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, true that, I'm going to do some shopping
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:22): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: after I deplete this jar of olives, I think only thing left will be to turn to rock soup
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:41): i'm amused at how dan and chris have just given up sending htmlwg status updates to the htmlcg list
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:53): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: For lack of content, or lack of interest, or something else?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:53): just haven't seen updates in a long time
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:08): maybe they don't attend the calls
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:08): or maybe HTML5 just doesn't need status updates, it's all over the place already anyway :)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:09): Yeah, it's public all over the place in htmlwg
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:12): the HCG should really become a public group
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:14): Hypertext Coordination Group also known as HTML CG
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:24): so who is steven faulkner going to interview for standards suck 4?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:32): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: There is no spoon!
